SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

NO. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: MRS. JESSIE PAYNE
2. Your address: Oliver Lodge
3. Date: March 28
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Kildonan Winnipeg
5. What was your father's name and occupation?: George Ross Farmer
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and Year): 7th Apr. 1905
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: Lived in Kildonan till 12 and then Balnoral
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc.): Born here
9. What were your reasons for coming West?: To homestead
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?): Some neighbors who had come to Maymont told us about it

11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
   With my mother & brother.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   By train to Lumsden & then by horse.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?
   In tents on the homestead.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
   Strasbourg.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
   Three years in Alberta; Left Strasbourg in June 1909; Came to Saskatoon in 1912.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
   At home on the farm driving oxen and helping to stow the land.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends, or other group)?

13. What means of transportation did you use? By train to Laramie & then by horse.

14. What incidents of the journey best do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

17. Mention any other places there you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

At home on the farm during new and helping to store the corn.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
Every week for a while and less often after a year.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.
Mrs. Lloydminster to John Wm. Payne, in 1910, July 11.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place to settle?

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West tell when they came and where they settled.
My brother & mother at the same time.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?
One summer the prairie was full of mosquitoes. Next year it was burnt off. Many prairie fires and most of them

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?
To church service 2 miles away in a neighbor's house. To P.O. four miles away on foot.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with their date and place of marriage.

21. Did anyone else come to Sebastopol because of your recommendation? If so, where did they settle?

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West tell when they came and where they settled.

23. In there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? By what means of travel?

To church service 2 miles away in a neighbor's house. To P.O. four miles away on foot.
25. When was the first car used in the community? 1916

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make? No

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home? Strasbourg 14 miles

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.). Yes

29. How often did you shop in the early days? About once a month

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays? When I visited there in 1916.

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.

When we first homesteaded we bought print and yarn and made most of our clothes

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it? No

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

Permanently

39. Questions regarding historical source materials:

Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old posters and programs, minute books of community organizations, old pamphlets, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe).

Have not kept any of these

Would you or the person who owns them either

(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying?

(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina, or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon? (Indicate your preference, if any)

40. If you have children or grandchildren, please give their names, where they live and occupations.
